intro: Tetranthera nigricans, commonly known as blackstem tetranthera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruits are small drupes that contain a single seed, and the plant is often found in forest understories. Tetranthera nigricans is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitat.
